text.p: Tropical cyclone Gavin is about 80 miles north-northeast of Nandi, Fiji and is tracking to the south-southwest at 13 mph. Gavin has top winds of 125 mph and will move over the westernmost part of Fiji over the next few hours, then continue southward and begin a weakening trend. The northern coastline can expect a damaging storm surge along with strong and damaging winds. Most of the region can expect heavy rains leading to flooding and winds strong enough to cause serious damage to property and most man-made structures. In addition the system will make for dangerous seas which will impact shipping in the area.

Tropical cyclone 32p has formed in the Coral Sea will east of Queensland Australia. Top winds are currently near 50 mph but they are expected to increase to 80 mph during the next 48-72 hours. This system is mostly a threat to shipping as it stays east of Australia during this period.
There are no further emergency statements at this time.
